contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Nakabaru'''|中原町|Nakabaru-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Miyaki District, Saga|Miyaki District]], [[Saga Prefecture|Saga]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 8,829 and a [[population density|density]] of 467.14 persons per km². The total area was 18.90 km². The status of Nakabaru was changed from a village to a town on April 1, 1971. On March 1, 2005 Nakabaru was merged with the towns of [[Kitashigeyasu, Saga|Kitashigeyasu]] and [[Mine, Saga|Mine]], all from [[Miyaki District, Saga|Miyaki District]], to form the new town of [[Miyaki, Saga|Miyaki]]. [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Saga Prefecture]] {{Saga-geo-stub}}
